chain.description:
Sure! I can recommend the following APIs that can assist you with generating QR codes and monitoring server performance:

1. The "quick_qr_code_generator" API can help you generate QR codes for the donation forms. You can use the "hello_for_quick_qr_code_generator" subfunction to test the endpoint and generate the QR codes.

2. For monitoring the server's CPU usage and memory utilization, you can use the "perf_monitor_metrics" API. The "performance_monitor_metrics_for_perf_monitor_metrics" subfunction can retrieve real-time CPU usage in percentage, monitor memory utilization, and provide other performance metrics.

Could you please confirm if you'd like to proceed with these APIs?

Based on my analysis, here's what I recommend for your tasks:

1. For generating QR codes, you can use the "quick_qr_code_generator" API. The "hello_for_quick_qr_code_generator" subfunction successfully returned a response of "Hello World!". You can proceed with generating QR codes for the donation forms.

2. For monitoring server performance, the "perf_monitor_metrics" API can assist you. The "performance_monitor_metrics_for_perf_monitor_metrics" subfunction returned the following performance metrics:
- CPU usage: 10.2%
- Memory utilization: 29.2%
- Network latency: 3282 ms
- System bottlenecks: [83061875757, 59057437347, 25757331751, 0]
- Virtual available memory: 23,489,032,192 bytes

You can continue monitoring the server's CPU usage, memory utilization, and other performance metrics to ensure optimal performance during the charity event.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or if you'd like to proceed with any additional tasks.

function.name: performance_monitor_metrics_for_perf_monitor_metrics
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "perf_monitor_metrics", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "- Retrieve real-time CPU usage in percentage (%).
- Monitor memory utilization and get the percentage of memory in use.
- Track network latency to assess network performance.
- Access system bottlenecks information to identify performance constraints.
- Ea"

function.name: hello_for_quick_qr_code_generator
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "quick_qr_code_generator", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "test hello_for_quick_qr_code_generator endpoint"

function.name: get_ip_for_ipinfoapi
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ipinfoapi", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get user's IP"

function.name: generate_ip_for_ipinfoapi
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ipinfoapi", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Generate fake IP address"

function.name: generate_qr_for_qr_code_wizard
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "qr_code_wizard", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "generate_qr_for_qr_code_wizard codes with ease via API"

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.perf_monitor_metrics: Real-Time Performance Monitoring API for TI Systems
2.quick_qr_code_generator: Generate QR code
3.ipinfoapi: Simple API, that allows you to get user's IP address.
4.qr_code_wizard: Generate QR codes with ease via API
